required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy Study of MAU868 for the Treatment of BK Viremia in Kidney Transplant Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Assess the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy of MAU868 for the Treatment of BK Viremia in Kidney Transplant Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical research study will test the safety and efficacy of the investigational medication MAU868, compared to a placebo, in patients who have had a kidney transplant who have active BK virus.

primary_outcome.measure: Time (weeks) to decrease of BKV plasma viral load by 1 log
primary_outcome.description: The efficacy of MAU868 in treating BK viremia will be measured primarily by measuring the BK Viral Load in the plasma over time.

primary_outcome.measure: Time (weeks) to first decrease of BKV plasma viral load to less than Lower Limit of Quantification (LLOQ)
primary_outcome.description: The efficacy of MAU868 in treating BK viremia will be measured primarily by measuring the BK Viral Load in the plasma over time.

arm_group.description: Cohort 1: MAU868 1350 mg IV approximately every 28 days for a total of 4 doses
Cohort 2: MAU868 6750 mg IV on Study Day 1 and then 1350 mg IV approximately every 28 days for a total of 4 doses
Cohort 3: MAU868 6750 mg IV approximately every 28 days for a total of 4 doses
5% dextrose in water [D5W] IV delivered every 28 days for a total of 4 doses

intervention.description: MAU868 is a human monoclonal antibody (IgG1) that binds the viral capsid protein, VP1, that is responsible for binding to the surface of host cells
250 mL D5W placebo IV to be labeled to match that of MAU868

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be a male or female 18 years of age or older.
- Recipient of a kidney (or kidney-pancreas) transplant within the year prior to enrollment
- Documented BKV viremia based on local or central laboratory testing within 10 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- A BKV plasma viral load which has exceeded 10^3 copies/mL for >4 months.
- A BKV plasma viral load of â‰¥ 10^7 copies/mL.
